Reviews.Title: “Basic amenities, but not sure if worth it”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastTripperII
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four-day stay over the Labor Day weekend and still having mixed feelings. We normally stay next door at The Flamingo Motel where we can get an ocean-facing room about a 1/4-block from the ocean for about $179.00. But we booked late and nothing was available so we opted for The Rodeway Inn. We did get a true ocean-front room, 2nd floor, but at a cost of $244.00 for Friday and Saturday nights ($210 for Sunday night), The Good: The two gentlemen at the front desk were pleasant enough and congenial. Although rough around the edges and a little crusty, Diane cleaned our rooms each day and did an adequate job. What we appreciated was her asking when we wanted it done and she made every effort to have it done for us. We were on the 2nd floor so could walk up/down after moving in so we could avoid the elevator. Ocean front room gave good views of the beach. In-room safe. Changing room and use of pools and parking lot before/after check in/out. The Bad There is only a single [slow] elevator servicing the entire ocean front hotel (thank goodness we were on the 2nd floor and could walk up/down staircase). The indoor pool was closed most of Sunday with no explanation given. The check in/out changing room was the bathroom in the indoor pool; my wife walked in, then immediately walked out because of the filth in and around the commode and lots of something smashed into the hard rubber mats on the floor. Granted, it was a Saturday on a holiday weekend but the parking lot full and we had search parking off-site and found it 2 blocks away. Felt defensive each day that housekeeping would ask if we "wanted service?" I thought cleaning the bathrooms, emptying trash, and making beds was part of the $244.00 I was paying for, not an option? Balcony had only a partial thin wooden barrier blocking neighbors, who could easily hop over the side railing or crawl under the barrier to gain access to our balcony. Although there was in in-room safe (thank goodness), the sliding patio door would not lock or even latch due to the entire handle being bent and loose; the sliding door was installed on the outside so unable to insert a bar to prevent opening; we were lucky no one realized they could hop onto our balcony as they could have walked right into our room and taken whatever they wanted. The Flamingo is no Hilton, but for $75.00 less per night, we will probably book earlier and stay there next time. Ocean front was nice, but not that nice at this hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “room actually updated a bit”
Reviews.Author: ssiegel
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay and I'm happy to report that, since my last review, the rooms have been a bit updated. The beds are still small (full size vs, quuen size?), but, thank goodness, the matress was new (I was not looking forward to sleeping on an old, mushy mattress). Also, there was a nice flat screen tv, and single handle faucets at sink and shower. The great parts are still great - fantastic location on the beach, large oceanfront room with two beds and a sleeper couch, small table and chairs, small fridge, sink, and microwave, oceanfront balcony. Fairly clean, plenty of towels.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place for family”
Reviews.Author: SnappleSpice
Reviews.Content: I was here for a week on a family vacation. We had a room on the 5th/top floor facing the ocean, which was a great view, especially from the balcony (we saw dolphins from our room!). The only awkward part was that one side of the balcony wasn't 100% closed off from the room next store, so we could see the other guests if we were both outside at the same time (it wasn't that bad though). I'm not a big beach fan, but my family is. We were right on the beach, which was good for them, but only a couple of minutes walk away from the end of the boardwalk, which was good for me. The end of the boardwalk doesn't have much though (only a handful of stores and an ice cream shop). We could walk to a bunch of restaurants and mini golf places. The free breakfast was decent, but you have to walk across the parking lot to the main office building (and where I think other rooms are located??) to get it. There is free wifi, but its fairly slow. The cleaning staff come daily, but we found they occasionally neglected certain things (like wiping down the table, replacing soap). Overall the staff is friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Adam W
Reviews.Content: This was a good value for the location and price. With just me and my girlfriend going, a small room with a queen bed was all we needed. It was nice to sit on the balcony and watch the traffic of Baltimore ave at night, especially seeing the amusement park. Service was EXCELLENT! We had a mix up at our time of check in with the price and since we booked for a few days, the lady at the desk allowed the balance to be paid on my payday on that Friday and we checked in on Wednesday. Can't say enough good thing about this place! Worth it!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Fender57
Reviews.Content: It's hard to rate these kind of hotels because of their location. This one happens to be in Ocean City, MD where everything, even the ice cream, is overpriced. I would never pay this much for a room of this quality anywhere else, but in OC, you take what you can get. Keep in mind we stayed in the street front and older side of the hotel, not the beachside, which costs more. The rooms are small, the beds are doubles, the place is run down, the breakfast area has 3 small tables and packaged bagels, and the indoor pool area is not well taken care of. However, it is a very short walk to the beach without crossing any streets. On the positive side, we left behind a very favorite doll in the room and when we later went to the desk to see if they had it...they did.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again gladly!Location is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Ladyinblack4
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and kept clean. The staff at front desk was helpful and willing to hold our room if we wanted to stay another night. The air conditioner could have been colder but the room stayed cool enough. The location is awesome! Literally a 2 minute walk to food, amusement, beach. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Love S
Reviews.Content: Came here as a family, hotel on beach is about the only good thing about it. The elevator to go up almost cuts your arm off, it is so quick to shut and it doesn't stop. We asked for a crib for the baby and they brought a crib from like 1990? It was rocking back and forth unsteady about to collapse with a mattress 3 times too small for it with holes in it! I called and asked for a new crib lady was cranky about it but said they would look. Kid came with new one still not good but better than what had earlier, but decided it was unsafe and didn't put baby in it. The Air conditioner had mold clearly all over it, it smelled bad in the room. Very small. Thin thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Most likely will not return”
Reviews.Author: cls187
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. It was so nice to park your car and leave it there for a few days, as it is walking distance from many things. However, at the rodeway, nothing seemed to work correctly from the start. We booked an oceanfront room online, only to be told upon arrival that our room wasn't available, due to an issue with our credit card (not my fault...just a technical glitch). I had received no email or any other notification of the problem. The manager was quite rude about it, but at least there was another room available. So we ended up with a room in the motel building, but the bright side was the cheaper rate. The elevator is dirty and a little scary. The building is in serious need of upgrade. Cleaning is shoddy at best. We received a 6am wakeup call that we did not request! On the 2nd day of our stay, both of our key cards mysteriously stopped working. When I took them to the desk, I was told it was probably my fault, because I surely kept them next to a cellphone or credit card. As it turned out, the batteries in the sensor had died, which they did replace promply. The air conditioner was on its last legs and was caked with dust or some mystery substance...it did not keep the room very cool. We had a lot of difficulty getting & maintaining a wifi connection. Two out of the three lights didn't work. But I do feel with a little effort & some basic upgrades, along with some lessons in customer service, this hotel has a lot of potential.

Reviews.Title: “I Do NOT recommend.”
Reviews.Author: obxbeachgoer2
Reviews.Content: Well, the location was convenient....that's really the only good thing the Rodeway has going for it. We experienced nothing but probelms right from the moment of check in. When we booked, we booked with a card that had since expired and been replaced. This had automatically cancelled our reservation, but we were not informed of this by email or phone. When we finished our six-hour drive to OC, we were told that the oceanfront room we had reserved had been given away and that the only vacancy they had was the streetside motel. We were really looking forward to an oceanfront room and instead were stuck with a commanding view of a concrete parking lot. We took that room, and the manager was completely unopologetic. His response was, and I quote, "well, you're supposed to use a good credit card". Yeah, thanks, buddy. The following morning, I went down to get some "breakfast", which turned out to be prepackaged bagels and generic instant oatmeal. When I got back to my room, I noticed that my key had fallen out of my pocket, and went searching back down the stairs for it until I reached the lobby. The young ladies at the table I was sitting at told me that they found it and turned it into the desk. I went to the desk and asked if I could have another key made, and the receptionist barked that since the room wasn't in my name, I could not have one made. Fair enough, I totally understand that security policy, but I then asked her if any keys had been turned in to get my old one back, and she said point blank "no". Now, keep in mind that this was after the people at the table I was sitting in told me they had turned it in. Ergo, she had my key and was saying she didn't...correct me if I'm wrong, but isn't that called lying? The location was convenient in the fact that we didn't have to cross Coastal Highway to reach the beach, but the cold and unhelpful desk staff completely ruined what could have been a decent stay. It is for that reason that we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience ! ! !6/15-18th”
Reviews.Author: Babyblue535
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just spent 4 days @ Roadway Inn and had a great experience. The room over looked Baltimore Ave. which was quiet compared to Coastal Hwy. We enjoyed the traffic and tourists going by. In the over night hours we never heard any noise. Our housekeeper did a fantastic job on the 2nd floor. And the cont breakfast was plentiful. The office staff was friendly. And for the money we received a lot more than we could imagine at this busy time of year. We plan to stay here again. And pass along the good word as to where to stay while visiting OCMD. I can't say enough about our Roadway Inn experience. But I'll stop and hope you get the idea.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is horrible in every possible way a hotel can be horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Sheldan21
Reviews.Content: The room was absolutely disgusting. There was hair everywhere, on the microwave, on the tv, pubic hair on the toilet and on the pillow!!!! Something sticky and brown was on the shower and on the bathroom floor. Something had splashed all over tv and the cleaning crew, if they even exist, didn't think these were important items to clean. We called the front desk to inform them of the room's condition and they sent someone up. We showed him all of these issues and we asked if the room had actually been cleaned. His response was "it should have been." We requested the dirty items be cleaned and the sheets changed in front of us and he said "or I could just give you your money back." Really!? We drive far to get here and there are no other rooms available on such late notice. We just requested again that they just adequately clean the room. He said he would send someone else to do it and we are still waiting a half an hour later....

Reviews.Title: “Owner called the cops on me when I tried to dispute a miscellaneous and safe warranty charges.”
Reviews.Author: dwc80
Reviews.Content: I booked online and the bill was $77.34. When I checked out. The bill was $82 something. They has charged me for miscellaneous and safe warranty. I asked them what was those charges for? They gave me an example for miscellaneous (electricity). So, I said, Isn't that part of the room rate? The safe warranty charge. They can't give me a good explanation either. They said those are valid charge. They said they are done talking about it and I told them I'm not done talking. They told me to leave or they will call the cops. I said. "go ahead, call the cops". The cops showed up and told me to leave. If you want them to call the cops on you, be my guess and stay at that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here many,many times and it never changes”
Reviews.Author: ssiegel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many, many times for 4-5 nights at a time from April through September. It never, ever changes. the GOOD: fabulous location on the ocean. Rooms have great views. Huge, oceanfront rooms with balconies looking out onto ocean. Balcony doors can be kept open all night to sleep to the sound of the ocean. Fridge and microwave are very convenient to have. Large indoor pool is great when it rains. Bathroom and shower available to use before or after you check in or out , if you want to use the beach. Pools and pool areas are kept clean. All the staff are friendly. the BAD: furnishings and decorations haven't changed for at least 10-15 years. free "breakfast" is just packaged muffins and danish. housekeeping staff are very nice, but not very thorough in their cleaning of the rooms (don't move furniture to clean behind or under, don't scrub undersides of bath and toilet fixtures). rooms all have two double beds and a sleeper couch, the mattresses are squishy and not too comfy - they really should upgrade some of the rooms to king size beds! Outdoor pool is oceanfront, but it gets little sun because it is in the shadow of the building. elevators are very slow. Kitchen utensils are probably stocked and checked once at the beginning of the season and then never rechecked or replenished. Ancient televisions do not even have input plugs to plug in your own dvds or other devices. Some of the air conditioning units on on their last legs and are very noisy (biut they seem to keep up with replacing them periodically). Overall, it is a decent value in Ocean City considering that most Ocen City in season rates are ridiculously high.

Reviews.Title: “A lot going for it, but needs a cleaning”
Reviews.Author: jingold
Reviews.Content: In most respects, this hotel was a very good deal for the money. We paid 110 after tax on a Saturday for a room with a balcony facing the ocean. The room was spacious with a couch, nice tv, ironing board, microwave and fridge. The location was just before the beginning of the boardwalk, which is pretty ideal because you can walk the boardwalk but don't have people walking in front of your room all the time. There was also a continental breakfast which was pretty weak, but given the room price and other amenities was fine by me. The thing that killed this place was the cleanliness. It was neat, but there were hairs on both the sheets and even in my bath towel. There were also little black specks of something on the sheets, a dead insect in the tub, and it looked like they hadn't vacuumed out the area under the sink in a very long time (lots of grime plainly visable when sitting on the toilet that the cleaners probably did not notice standing up). This didn't kill the trip for us since we are not super fussy about that sort of thing but could easily be a killer for lots of people. I would suggest that they maybe cut some of the other amenities in exchange for some training for the cleaning staff (or financial incentives for them). Cleanliness is not a good place to cut corners. But man, it was a great view...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay and Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kaye H
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with Kristina - "The Only Good Thing Was The View" Beds were hard as rocks and the springs came through. My husband and I accually woke feeling like someone beat us. When you called to speak to management, all they did was laugh and say that yes all the beds in other rooms are the same. "After all we bought them from the the same place" The air conditioner had mold all over it and when you turned in on it spelled like urine. There were beer bottle caps under the filthy couch (had stains all over the cushions) and balcony. We asked for our money back and mangement just laughed again. Unfortunely we could not find anywhere else to stay because other places were full or had a 3-day minimum so we were stuck there. We took the mattress off the pull out sofa and put in on the bed so that we could talerate the next two days. The Continental breakfast sucked and you had to go to another building to get it. Worst experience ever. I will be letting the BBB know this and the Chamber of Commerce in OC. Someone needs to address this!

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing was the view”
Reviews.Author: Kristina_V505
Reviews.Content: Bedding & couch filthy, management rude, fire alarm went off for no reason, keys didn't work so we were stuck in room, breakfast choices terrible bagel in a bag, tiny danish in bag, instant oatmeal

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: DoniceJ
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and affordable place with a great location in Ocean City. I had two oceanfront suites for a great price. My son and I have been coming here since he was two and he will be 15 this year and the hotel manger still remembers us. The location on the beach, near the carnival and other activities makes it the perfect location for family fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for ocean front”
Reviews.Author: Clynelish
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in an ocean front room on the second floor, nice, but I'd want to go higher (There are five floors.). The room and bathroom were clean and kept that way by the hardworking staff. The sliding glass door to the balcony had no screen door, a shame because the sound of the ocean at night was preferable to the loud rumbling of the through-the-wall air conditioner. The A/C admittedly did keep the room cool. We finally cracked the door a bit to escape the artificial noise; no problem with mosquitos. The "climb-around or crawl-under" partitions on our balcony made us a little uneasy; why don't the partitions extend low enough or out enough to keep our neighbors from possibly coming over to "visit"? Indoor heated pool was very nice as was outdoor pool. If you have a first floor room you and the outdoor pool users can get to know each other; take a first floor room only to avoid a room in the streetside annex with the parking lot view. The "free continental breakfast" offered in the office lobby is absolutely dreadful; ghastly plastic wrapped bagels and muffins that taste like sweetened cardboard, bad coffee and so-so juice. Rodeway should abandon this "perk" or expend just a little effort to put out better food. Indeed, why not just include a free voucher, say, $3 per guest at the McDonald's across the road for breakfast items that are far more edible( We stayed at a HoJo's in St. George UT that had multiple cereal choices, oatmeal packets, fresh fruit, bread and English muffins for toasting plus decent coffee, Twinings tea and juice in a small but pleasant breakfast room, all at a most reasonable room rate.).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, affordable place to rest. Hard to find in Ocean City, MD.”
Reviews.Author: Weezulman
Reviews.Content: We stay down in Ocean City quite a bit for nighttime entertainment, and finding a clean and affordable place is always like finding a needle in a haystack. $90 total for a one night Saturday stay at this time of year usually puts you in a roach motel. Both front desk clerks that I iteracted with were knowledgeable and friendly. The room wasn't the grandest in the land, but it had all of the usual amenities that you expect to find at this rating level. Everything was clean and in working order, the bed was comfortable, and surprisingly, the location was quiet, I thought it would be noisier. The hotel is right on the beach with beach access, and has two pools. Very impressed with the facility for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie S
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here again and the price was just right! We stayed in the oceanfront part of the hotel and it was much better than I expected. When I booked the hotel I was nervous because it was so cheap but it really exceeded my expectations. The front desk staff was very helpful and the room was clean and relatively roomy. I stayed with my husband and our 2 and 4 year old boys and I did not really feel too cramped for all the more we were in the room. We had a hard time keeping a wifi signal but other than that I had no complaints. We loved the balcony, the ocean view, and the 2 pools. It was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Cathy B
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just wanted a quick trip to the beach before jumping into our fall schedules. We were just going to go for the day, but then I saw the reviews for Rodeway and decided it was worth it to have a shower and bathroom handy, and then we could spend the better part of two days at the beach! The staff were very friendly. We arrived 2 hours before check-in and they told us we could park, use the bathrooms and changing rooms and the pools (indoor and out) all before we checked in to our room! Then when we were checking out, we asked if we could leave the car in the lot for a while and they once again offered all the same amenities! We also received a free upgrade to an oceanfront room! Our quick trip couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Homemom49
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed here . We love the location( 2 blks past end of boardwalk), and the oceanfront rooms are wonderful! We love the mini fridge(waist high one) so we can put in juices and water and leftovers that we can reheat in the microwave! I can overlook the fact that the line to hang wet suits on in bathroom wasn't there or there was a bit of rust on that hardware that was supposed to have that line. You have a continental breakfast in the bldg where you check in. This is great for something lite. My only problem is that you have guests filling up there big travel mugs and thus having the employees making coffee more often! Should be a sign stating please use foam cups provided. Those guests are being rude! This is the least expensive hotel on beach w/oceanfront rooms, trust me, I have checked! We enjoyed ourselves immensely and it was so convenient to go down to beach and pool and go up to room when needed. I just wish the owners would maybe update bathrooms with a different shade of paint and shower heads. Other than that, go and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “We will probably be back”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: This was a budget hotel in a good location (ocean front and two blocks from the north end of the boardwalk) so it was expensive (about $680 for three nights with taxes) for what you got in amenities. There were two sections of the hotel. We stayed in the part of the hotel near the road which was adequate. The other part of the hotel overlooks the ocean but was a lot more money. Our two double bed room was small for the money but relatively clean and up to date except for the tube TV. The bathroom was also small but clean. The double beds were not too bad but they were noisy when you moved around. The breakfast was complementary packaged pastries and coffee. It was okay, not great. The kitchen area was clean. The front desk staff was nice but not overly friendly. Our toilet did get clogged once during our stay and the maintenance person fixed it within an hour of calling for help. There was sufficient parking and the parking lot had lights so it felt secure. I would stay again in this hotel but not if it was much more money. I stayed in the Paradise on the boardwalk about five years ago and the Rodeway Inn was much cleaner and less expensive from what I can remember.

Reviews.Title: “So, So.....”
Reviews.Author: Amy R
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel if you do not want frills and are on a tight budget. I am not one to complain and I definitly do not have one here. We stayed just one night (was booked for 2 but had to leave early bec of home life, booked thru expedia so knew I was not getting my money back) no issues. Rooms are on the small side, smoking was def a smoking (you could smell it). Everyone was nice that I ran into. I would suggest getting a room on the beach side location. Building by the road is ok, just not close to the pool. Thanks for an OK stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ktjnemo
Reviews.Content: Great location just a couple blocks from the north end of the boardwalk! Glad we stayed off -boardwalk, nicer view with dunes in front instead of cement, crowds, and trolleys. Fantastic view and easy beach access from the Ocean Front building!!! The room was spacious and clean, beds were comfortable (except motel standard bedspreads-brought my own comforter), nice little kitchenette (coffee maker, microwave, mini fridge, basic dishes, no oven), good counterspace in bathroom. Balconies were reasonably private with stall-type wall between. Indoor and outdoor pool were a little cloudy but they vacuumed out all the sand every morning. Off street parking was always available. The service people were nice, taking time to give me directions/recommendations. Sometimes took the stairs down because the elevator was kinda slow at peak times. Free wireless internet was available but slow and not always dependable (still nice for a quick review check :). No guest laundry but laundromat across the street if you needed it. As with any beach motel, stay above the 1st floor (dunes) for a better view. Overall, no complaints-would definately stay again! I suggest calling the hotel direct-I got an oceanfront room that wasn't on the itnernet and a better price.

Reviews.Title: “It fit our needs just right.”
Reviews.Author: jwags99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what we visited it for. It offers a convienient location right on the ocean at 30th street. The hotel consists of two buildings, a motel building and the oceanfront building. We stayed in the oceanfront building. The room was nice. It had two double beds and a sofat with a pullout bed. The room also features a balcony overlooking the ocean. There is an indoor and outdoor pool as well. The outdoor pool closes at 6 PM which is quite early but on the bright side the indoor pool is open until 10. This hotle also had a free breakfast but it was nothing special just juice and some prepackaged pastries but the room had a small kitchen with a microave so if you wanted you could bring some food and eat it in the room. The housekeeping staff was very nice. On several ocasions I was aksed by the housekeeper if I needed anything else in the room. Unlike many OC hotels the housekeepers speak English here. That is very nice for communication when you need something. Overeall I reccomend this hotel to someone who wants a nice room at a very reasonale rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: Stef319
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted a no-frills, affordable room in a good location with internet access. We were not disappointed. The room was very clean, the bathroom-which was white- was spotless. We stayed two nights for under $300. We had a fridge, microwave, and balcony- and for a couple who likes to spend their money on activities like jet-skiing and para-sailing, this hotel fit us perfectly. I'm not sure about the quality of the pools because we had fantastic weather and if I'm at the beach, I'll swim in the ocean. The service was average; the staff was professional but didn't do back-flips for us. We're not needy people, though. I work in the hospitality industry and I get so irritated with reviews that pick apart places. The reality is that some people are never happy and complain about something everywhere they go. I will definitely return to this hotel my next trip to OC.

Reviews.Title: “No customer services”
Reviews.Author: Sallya13
Reviews.Content: The toilet keep overflowing , manager was very rude and acted as if it was our fault we had to leave the hotel without be able to take a shower I am file a complaint with the chambers of ocean city

Reviews.Title: “great location, but dirty”
Reviews.Author: ayoungpretender
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. It is right on the beach and near the northern end of the boardwalk. It has both an indoor and outdoor pool. The efficiency rooms had a fridge, microwave, and dishes and silverware. The only bad thing about the place was the cleanliness. There were stains on the carpet, towels and furniture. There were even holes in the walls and cabinets. The floors of the hallways, staircase and elevator were dirty. There was no ice machine on our floor and in the walk within the building to get ice left the bottom of my feet black. For the price, they could do a much better job with the upkeep on this place. Overall, not bad and a good deal if you don't have high standards for cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Good service & value”
Reviews.Author: jcraig10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while the Corvette Convention was in town. The room was good for the money paid - which was close to nothing since it was in the off season (PLUSSSS +++). When we first got to the room the toilet was clogged & there was no plunger, so we called the front desk and they were able to come up and get it fixed for us right away. Oh btw, we stayed in the motel portion that is right on the street. The only other thing was that we were right by the elevator which was old and made a lot of noise that we could hear from our room, but no big deal to us. We had a balcony that looked out onto Philadelphia Ave (although it was a bit too chilly & windy to go out there!!! haha!) All in all, a good place to stay for 1 night on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jas7437
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised! Large room, very clean. Staff was very friendly and professional. Great location too. Wish these hotels would stop using creepy nylon bedspreads, but all in all very happy with our stay. The room rate was reasonable considering that it was such a busy weekend in OC, and that we booked the room last minute. The pool looked VERY nice. We stayed in the older part of the hotel - on the street side. From the outside, it looked like it was going to be a disaster, but it was FUN! We'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kae23
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to the ocean front building - on the 1st floor. Real neat experience. We had the indoor pool at the one hallway of our room - walk thru the room to the outdoor pool and the ocean. Breakfast was nothing special but they did have some pippin hot coffee which was tasty. The staff was real nice. September is an awesome time to go to the beach!! I think we found our new favorite hotel when we go to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Oceanfront building”
Reviews.Author: Daveh282001
Reviews.Content: It'll cost more, but the building is newer and comfortable. This is our third time staying at this hotel and the service is consistent year after year. We have booked typically in September because the rates are much more attractive and the crowds are thinner. This year we brought the grandkids, so we had to book during peak season (and price). The service was just as good as when we stay later in the summer. We have an oceanview and the room is clean and comfortable. Two pools; one in and one out. I don't know why they close the outside pool at 6pm. I think that that's way too early. The indoor one is large and stays open until 10pm. Thank God. The boys were in it every night. until it closed. Staff is cordial and responsive. Continental breakfast, but very limited seating.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: tjjgraves59
Reviews.Content: cost a lot - did not get anything no screen on balcony so the flies and gnat just came in - the noise from neighbors and the smell of drugs

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! Worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: TinaBNE
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible! The service was shocking. Don't even bother with this place. Our air conditioner did not work and the 3rd day of our stay they decide to finally get maintenance to have a look at it. Management thinks its okay for their employees to walk straight into your room WITHOUT knocking, whilst you have the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door handle, WHILST someone is taking a shower. Then when told if they could return later (because someone is in the shower), they refuse and walk right in (and don't even fix the unit). The staff are completely and utterly rude. There are many other hotels in OCMD, do yourself the favor and avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but nothing else positive”
Reviews.Author: wvuengr12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel b/c we wanted a cheap weekend get away and nothing was left for this price range. The hotel room was clean, check in and out was easy, the front desk staff was friendly but the rooms were old. No upgrades have been done to this place for a long time. We didn't have an alarm clock, one painting was missing of the wall, the shower head would fall off every few minutes. I would not recommend anyone go here unless you had no other options.

Reviews.Title: “affordable comfort”
Reviews.Author: summernewjersey
Reviews.Content: i really liked this hotel because the room was clean and comfortable. the bed was the most comfortable bed ive ever slept in while on vacation. they have 2 hotels,one facing the street/lot, and one facing the ocean. i was in the one facing the street and all u had to do was cross the lot to get to the beach. it was a lot cheaper than the oceanfront property. staff was polite but not overly friendly. only thing i didnt like was when people went in and out at night they kept slamming the door and it kept waking me up. the hotel is on the quiet side of town and you have to walk 2 blocks to reach the boardwalk. you can take the tram for$3 down to any part of the boardwalk or $2 for an all day bus pass that goes up and down coastal hwy all day.otherwise i had a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and this is all you'll get”
Reviews.Author: BTT
Reviews.Content: It's on Ocean front but has rooms directly on (I'm not kidding) the street. People walking on the street can knock on your door or window. At the same time, the building is very old and very noisy (of course, you're ON the street that never sleeps in the summer days). Break fast is basic and adequate, as their staff. room is basically clean but the towels had some left over hair.

Reviews.Title: “Plain.......Boring”
Reviews.Author: heysoulsister
Reviews.Content: Nothing about this hotel is memorable. I guess it was clean but I wasn't impressed at all. The pool was really small. If you're older and you just want to get out and stay at somewhere next to the beach for 2-4 days I suppose this will do, but with a family with teenagers this hotel was just boring...

Reviews.Title: “Way better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: angel2115
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I needed a quick getaway. When we arrived at the Rodeway, the building/motel where you check in looks just like the other cheapie hotels/motels on Baltimore Ave. We had an ocean view so we were in the tower on the beach. The room was great! This place far exceeded my expectations. The hall was clean and it smelled very nice. There was also an indoor pool. The room was clean and it smelled very nice as well. The silverware in the kitchen was spotless as well as the bathroom. The ocean view was wonderful and the room was a decent size. There is a small dining table in the room next to the balcony overlooking the ocean. Perfect scene for a meal. The balcony is nice, although I wish they were a bit more private. They have half walls kind of like a bathroom stalls. It's kind of odd seeing a neighbor trying to peek at you through the gaps! My only qualm is not with this establishment but some of the guests that were staying there. As I stated above there were people trying to peer through the gaps when they heard the balcony door open. In my case it was two older men who did nothing but drink beer and smoke cigarretts on the balcony during their stay. There was also a noisy family a few doors down. There must have been at least 6 people in that room. We could hear them in our room. (I can imagine what those in between went through!) When they were on the balcony they were so loud, their voices echoed & vibrated the steel on the balcony. Very annoying to listen to when you are trying to relax. Altoghether, it was a nice place. We make several trips to OC every year. We plan on coming here again next year. This place was way better than I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “It was better than I expected!!”
Reviews.Author: susieq457
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in August. It was direct oceanfront with 2 double beds and a sofa sleeper. It had a microwave and small frig...bathroom was nice and big (maybe a handicapped one?) There was a continental breakfast (bagels, muffins and small pastries) coffee juice and tea. This was more than adequate for my boys 19 and 15. We were on the busline and you can ride all day for 2.00. The room was clean and neat. The balcony was fine as was the whole stay. This hotel was significantly less per night than any around and it was definitely great for the money. Oh, it also had a great large indoor pool and an outside pool...the outside pool was a little dated, but it served the purpose on the 90 degree days. All in all it was better than I thought and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay a second time...”
Reviews.Author: Tazdoc1
Reviews.Content: My greatest issue with Rodeway Inn Oceanfront is the lack of cleanliness in the bathroom such as hairs in the bathtub from the previous tenants, mold surrounding the top of the bathtub wall, and rusted out metal fixtures. As soon as we saw the bedcovers, we could tell they hadn't been washed from one guest to the next. The room overall had a "icky" creepy crawly feeling to it - not just to me but to my kids. Other than those issues, the staff was nice and accomadating with exception to the laziness and unthoroughness of housekeeping. The oceanfront room was nicely appointed and the beds were comfortable to sleep in. There's an refrigerator & microwave in the room with a complete set of dishes for your convenience. The room came with a private balcony overlooking the pool and deck with a direct unobstructed view of the ocean, beach, & dunes. There's an outdoor pool as well as a very nice heated indoor pool. The location is about two blocks from the end of the boardwalk & centrally located to stores, fast food, restaraunts, & amusements such as the Jolly Roger which is located literally across the street. If you need an economic place to stay, this would be the place.

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary...Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: Homemom49
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here 8-17 to 8-22-09. Have been here 2 other times, so we know what to expect. What we got was a great room in the oceanfront bldg on 4th floor. These rooms have 2 double beds and a sofabed, plenty of room for 3 adults and a 10 yr old.The kitchenettes are great, as they allow you to heat up some snacks or dinners in the microwave, toasters or toasting bagels or bread. The counter height refrigerators are great also. Room for the bottled water to take down to the beach!!Oceanfront rooms are the way to go here, as the streetside rooms are not as nice, from what I remember from years ago. We had no problems, except that one day, the elevator wasn't working for a good part of the day. This would be the only complaint. They could really use a second elevator here.This hotel is at quiet end of boardwalk ( only a block and a half away). Continental breakfast served in lobby consists of pastries, bagels, muffins, juices and coffee and tea. This worked out fine for us. We only had a sitdown breakfast one morning, at a hotel 2 bldgs over.. Another thing that they could update would be the shower heads in bathroom. A little bit more pressure would have been great! Housekeeping was wonderful, always had plenty of towels, and we had no problems with bugs, as another review had mentioned. Would I recommend this hotel , absolutely! Price is right. Always ask about discounts. We had AAA, but a discount for staying there before actually was lower than the AAA rate. This was withing walking distance of restaurants, a golf course, and the Jolly Roger Amusement Park and Water Park. Just remember, You are always going to find a few reviews that aren't good, but that could be the guests themselves that just want to find something to complain about. You get what you pay for, and I think that the Rodeway Inn is a great place to stay when in Ocean City!!

Reviews.Title: “HEAD LICE INFESTATION--Room 301”
Reviews.Author: Eable
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 301 Rodeway Inn oceanfront 2 weeks ago for 2 nights --our kids and my wife and I now have head lice and nits that persist despite mutiple treatments (RID, NIX etc) I am calling the Company headquarters and the local heath department on Monday

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for the worst”
Reviews.Author: thelibster
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on tripadvisor ratings but this hotel setup is very deceiving and you will either love it or hate it. My advice, it's not really worth the risk. There are 2 parts to the complex, the motel side and the hotel side. We thought since we were paying over $200/night we would be in the hotel side of the complex. Wrong, we ended up staying in the motel side of the complex. When we asked if we could move, we were told it would be extra making the stay $300/night. Neither side of this complex is worth $300 - in fact, the absolute most I would pay for a room here is $120/night. The motel side is VERY outdated - outside steps to access your room (with no security - the door opens for everyone), an elevator so old that after riding it once we decided to hike our bags up the outside stairs and the rooms were quite outdated. Also, don't rely on the continental breakfast, we ended up having to go out for breakfast since there was nothing but juice and pastries wrapped in plastic. I can't say our stay was terrible, the room served it's purpose and since we weren't there much we were OK with it. The front desk and cleaning staff were all very polite and the location was very convenient to both the beach and boardwalk. I just can't recommend this hotel based on the price - especially since you don't know what you're getting until you get there. Maybe if we stayed on the hotel side for what we paid, we may have a different opinion.

Reviews.Title: “close to ocean and very clean”
Reviews.Author: ruger290
Reviews.Content: We did not stay in the oceanfront hotel, but the rodeway hottl behind it. It was half the price and just had to cross the small parking lot to get to the ocean. No oceanview but we were going to be on the beach all day anyway. We had reserved a non smoking room but was given a smoking room, we went up to check it out anyway and there was not any cigarette smell in the room or in the hallway so we stayed. They would have given us an upgrade but they were full. The room was very clean and there were four fluffy towels of each size in the very clean bathroom. The room could have been a little cooler but the airconditioner face the fridge. We were two blocks from the boardwalk and we were able to spend more money with the money we saved not goung oceanfront. We will definitley go back to this hotel! The staff was very helpful when we needed directions to a friends deli in PA. There are 2 pools indoor and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great price...Good location...Could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: Smeags
Reviews.Content: I went with a few other friends as a quick trip before the summer was over. The goal was a nice day trip with minimal costs. After reading the reviews I decided it wasn't too bad, and we'd try it out. The location was pretty good! We only had to walk across the parking lot in order to get to the beach (there are two buildings, we stayed in the one that is not beachfront). Also it's on 29th street, which is where the Boardwalk train ends!!! - $6 round trip from end of the boardwalk to end! We arrived early and were able to use the indoor pool area to change so we could get on the beach. We were also able to use the pool area once we had checked out, so that we could hang out on the beach and then clean up prior to driving home!! The front desk people were friendly...the breakfast looked ok for a cheaper hotel...but the room left a lot to be desired. Again, we knew we had only paid 177 for the night, so our expectations weren't super high. The sliding door to the balcony was stuck, it took all of our strength to open and close it. The shower still had dark hair in it (which I cleaned out before the other girls saw it...afterall I boooked the room!) But finally - you can only use ONE ELECTRICAL outlet at one time. We had 4 girls, and tried to use 2 hairdryers at one time - power went out....so we tried to do one hairdryer and one straight iron - power went out.....we ended up heating up the straight irons in the hallway (away from our room to avoid the power going out again!) Overall, if you're looking for a cheap place to stay, and don't care too much about the room GO FOR IT! If you want a nice place to stay with low cost....keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “customer service leaves a lasting impression!”
Reviews.Author: PUPPY50
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at your hotel, I was not welcomed by your staff. Immediately I thought the worst. In all of our opinions we felt that the service was very poor, when you would ask a question YOUR STAFF did not want to help or explain anything, they would point or say over there and remain expressionless. THAT IS NOT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!! THE GOOD POINTS ABOUT YOUR HOTEL WAS THE MAID, INDOOR POOL AND THE LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean front is the only way to go!!!”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslandRubbles
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel the 11th through the 13th. With a AAA discount, this was one of the best deals we found in Ocean city. There are two parts to this hotel, the “ocean front side” and “street side”. We checked in late and the only room left was on the street side. The room was small and older, and honestly, the sink area was not cleaned from the previous guest. Because our room faced the street, we kept the curtains closed for privacy. This made the room seem dark and dingy. I went to the front desk the next day, and paid a bit extra to upgrade to an ‘ocean front room’. IT WAS LIKE A COMPLETELY DIFFERENT HOTEL!! It seemed like we moved from a bad “1 star” to a nice “2 star” hotel. The room looked new and was very clean. Everything smelled great. The fridge was bigger, and we had a sink and a balcony facing the ocean. So, long story short, “ocean front room” is the only way to go. It’s a little extra but worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value! Good location, nice beach/pool, adequate amenties”
Reviews.Author: LinMd
Reviews.Content: Several friends have recommended this Rodeway over the years and we finally had to opportunity to stay. It was perfect! A very good location and value. We did not move our car the entire time we were there! We ate at PGN crab house across the street, had take out lunch on the beach from Tony's sub shop, breakfast at happy jack's pancake house and took the boardwalk tram/bus to the pier and rides at night. Just a perfect family trip. The beach is nice and the pool is adequate. Ocean front rooms are clean with a beautiful view. What money we saved staying at the Rodeway we were able to spend on FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Rodeway Inn Oceanfront, not your typical Rodeway Inn”
Reviews.Author: tonofmayonaise
Reviews.Content: I was in the Ocean City area for work at the beginning of June and was looking for a decent priced room by the ocean. The Rodeway Inn Oceanfront was cheap compared to other hotels in the same area which is normally a given for the Rodeway branded hotels. I was hesitant at first to book the room but after reading reviews here on Tripadvisor I was pretty impressed. I certainly didn't expect it to be ranked among the top 20 hotels in OC. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, check-in was easy and the extra $20 for an oceanfront suite was well worth it. I was able to get the oceanfront room during Senior Week and the OC Air Show for just $99! The room was clean and the bathroom was nicely stocked with soft, fresh linens. The beds were clean, the bedding was not something you'd find in a Hampton Inn or comparable hotel, but they were at least average. I stay in hotels an average of twice a week for work and have seen a wide range of hotel rooms. I would rate the staff a perfect 10, the rooms a 7, and the location/value a 10. Don't let the low price and brand name fool you, the Rodeway Inn Ocean front in OC is a place I have on the top of my list for when I stay in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: margaretyale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rodeway Inn Oceanfront the weekend of May 30-31, 2009 just for a quick last-minute weekend beach getaway. Trip included my husband and two teenagers. I was concerned at having made the reservation at the last minute but when we arrived everything was exactly as requested, the service was exceptional and the staff very friendly and courteous throughout. At one point our toilet clogged and I called the desk - staff arrived within moments and cheerfully resolved the problem. The bathroom was stocked with loads of thick fluffly towels and there was a little kitchenette with fridge, sink, microwave and dishes and utensils. A room safe is provided with key. A continental breakfast also is provided - Sara Lee bagels, danish and muffins with juice, coffee and tea. The hotel is only two short blocks from the end of the boardwalk and the tram station is right there - only $3 per person and the tram runs all the way to the opposite end where the pier and boardwalk amusement parks are (about 2 miles I think, end to end). The beach in front of the hotel is nice - not so crowded as the beachfront further down on the boardwalk, yet the boardwalk and amusement parks are close enough to be convenient for the teenagers without them having to drive anywhere - a huge convenience if you have teenagers! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: shelbyblue
Reviews.Content: Just got back from uor fist trip to Ocean City MD.After reading reviews we gave the Roadway Inn a try and were not dissapointed too much.First of all we are a family of four an 8 year old and a 14 year old,the rooms have 2 beds and is on the small side but did have a table for eating ,a 19inch t.v iron and blow dryer.this hotel is very bright clean carpets and paint and frienly staff,we enjoyed a nice size indoor pool also they have a outdoor pool.Location of the hotel is at 28th street at the end of the boardwalk a plus or minus depending on what you like,bus is pay one time for the whole day of we found 6 hour parking for 5 bucks downtown.I would like to say that Ocean city itself is clean and beatiful sand is clean really clean water is clear and clean amusements are wonderful if you like VA beach you will never go back after going to Ocean City and the Roadway Inn is a great stay for the price just booked for August.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again. Booking now for August.”
Reviews.Author: buffy19712000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this weekend may 29th- 31. We enjoyed our stay in ocean city so much we extended our stay to Monday. For the most part the staff was friendly. We aren't looking for much when we go away. A clean room. yes. continental breakfast. yes. Friendly staff. yes. If you plan on staying in your room, you might want a better hotel. We get out and only come back to sleep so, this was fine. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “id stay here agaim”
Reviews.Author: prdmm27
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for the weekend of 10-17 to 10-19. the room was very clan and staff very friendly. just if you have kids stay in the oceanfront building that way the pool is in the same building. the standard view rooms are across the parking lot and it makes it a cold walk for the little 1s. The pool wasnt that warm but it was nice to relax and get away.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Great Experiences at the Rodeway Inn!”
Reviews.Author: dawndell
Reviews.Content: This was the third year we stayed at the Rodeway Inn. My family was looking for a change of pace/scenery from the Jersey Shore we had frequented since we were kids. We originally found it by calling all the Ocean Front hotels up and down the beach. The Rodeway Inn had the best prices by far so we gave it a shot. The first year (2006) my family (me, husband and 2 children-6 and 2 at the time) and my parents went and had adjoining rooms-which was great for the kids to spend time with them. The last 2 years my brother's family (consisting of his wife and 3 kids-now 8, 4 and 4 months) joined us as well. We all feel we could not have made a better choice!! The rooms are clean and big-2 double beds and then a fold out couch-with a partition between them. There is a small table and chairs and a coffee table and a TV armoire and dresser w/ mirror. There is a small kitchen area with a little fridge, sink and microwave-also a little coffee maker. There is an area to hang clothes with a safe also. The bathroom is spacious with a tub shower and a large vanity/counter area. The first 2 years we were able to have the couch opened up and also had a crib (the hotel provided) set up in the room all at once and were still able to easily move around once adjusting the table/chairs and coffee table. The absolute BEST feature is the veranda. What an amazing view of the ocean-which is just steps away. They have chairs and a small table out there and there is plenty of space to have a few people sit comfortably. If you have the adjoining rooms-the verandas have a partial half wall so you can chat out there yet they are private enough if you don't know your neighbors also. Every night I'm there, after the kids are in bed, I sit outside and read a book and enjoy the ocean breeze and watch the people strolling the beach in the moonlight. Aside from one dragonfly this year-I have never had any issues with bugs at all while out there either-a BIG difference from Jersey! The outdoor pool is directly down below and just beyond that is the short path through the dunes onto the beach. The beaches are clean and safe-they have umbrella rentals ($15/day) and chair rentals available on the beach and there are also some people that walk around and ask to take pictures of your family or kids (there is a fee only if you buy them). When you return from the beach you can rinse your feet (and beach toys if you have kids) right as you walk off the beach as the hotel has a little shower at the edge of the pool. There is also an indoor pool with windows all around making it light and bright and great for after the beach or for a rainy day or late night swim (it's open until 10pm) There are also bathrooms and changing rooms in there-a great plus when you are at the beach and need a quick place to go! The staff is great-very friendly and helpful! Check in and out is always quick and they are great at accomodating requests (our 3 rooms are always right next to each other). The continental breakfast isn't glamorous but it works well for mornings when you just want to get out to the beach first thing. They added bagels this year which was a nice treat for something different. The other choices are Sara Lee packaged muffins and danishes-not bad at all. Coffee is available all day. Also there is a soda machine outside the lobby. There is lots of parking available and unless you get back really late at night you can usually get a spot right near the entrance. Even if not-it's a short walk-and the elevator is right near the entrance also. There are also entrances on both sides of the building (in addition to the center one) and one has a ramp for luggage carts or strollers. Location is great-one short block from the Jolly Roger Amusement Park, Go Karts and the Water Park. You can walk to several kinds of restaurants including 2 crab houses, an Italian place, McDonalds, Tommy's Sub Shop, and many others. The boardwalk is about a 5 minute drive down the road and parking in the municipal lot is easy and cheap and gives you a very short walk across the street to the rides and arcades. It's not fancy or first class-but it's perfect for an affordable convenient laid back family vacation! This year over the course of 5 days-my son didn't take out his Nintendo DS once-now THAT is saying something :) We can't wait until next year's trip to Ocean City and our stay at the Rodeway Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: Stacey6574
Reviews.Content: I had been looking over the internet for weeks trying to find an oceanfront hotel that had reasonable prices and good reviews. I came across this one and at least got the good reviews. The prices I found online turned out to be higher than when I called the hotel itself and I ended up paying about $300/night. For that price I expected much better. The staff was excellent! I had to call twice, once for the original reservation and again to change days. Both times the man who answered the phone was friendly and helpful. When we arrived too early for checkin the man at the front desk was friendly and quick to preregister us. He also welcomed us to use the changing rooms at the indoor pool, use either of the pools or just spend a few hours on the beach until our room was ready and we could pick up our key. We had an upper floor balcony reserved, but had to switch our days and ended up with 1st floor oceanfront. The view was OK, you can see the ocean but not the beach and the outdoor pool is right in front of you. It was convenient to be able to let the kids swim while we were getting ready in the room and still be able to watch them. Both pools were great with plenty of cushioned lounge chairs to go around. The indoor pool is surrounded by sliding glass doors which were open. It's bright and breezy in there and no overwhelming chlorine smell. The room itself had an unusual odor the moment you step through the door. There was also an odor on the patio coming from the A/C unit. It should be known though, that I've been accused of having a "bionic nose" and being a little sensitive to smell. That being said, neither odor was so persistent that I even bothered to notify the front desk. The carpeting seemed either new or very well cared for. It was soft and comfy, not even a little sticky like you sometimes get at the beach. The room had 2 double beds, a pull out love seat, and a kitchenette. The beds were a bit small to me, I'm used to a king size, but they weren't too uncomfortable. The sheets on both beds were stained but seemed clean. There were extra pillows already in the room. The loveseat was clearly dirty and stained, we never opened it, didn't even want to see the inside. The kitchenette had a nice fridge, microwave, coffee pot, toaster dishes, and glasses. It was really nice. This was the first time we stayed somewhere off the boardwalk. It's only about 2 blocks to the boardwalk, but we like to go back and forth from the beach to the boardwalk pretty frequently for food, drinks or just walk around. I expected more for my money and for that reason would probably not stay here again. We have decided to go back to staying on the boardwalk and for that reason will definitley not stay here again. We're going to try out The Stowaway Grand Hotel on 21st and boardwalk next time.

Reviews.Title: “loved the view”
Reviews.Author: DMS27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days this month. Great location, room was very spacious and airy. Stayed on 3rd floor with ocean front room. I agree it was very quiet even with families all around. Just down the elevator, out the door and you were at the beach. The only difficulty was getting into the building - had to climb stairs to get to 1st floor and then elevator. May be hard for some people. The boardwalk was just a few minutes away from the hotel. Each room had a refrigerator, sink and microwave. The breakfast was plain - prepackaged bagels and pastries - but at least they were fresh and untouched by others. My only complaint is that they should have had jelly and/or peanut butter to go along with the cream cheese and butter. Fine for what it was. Coffee all day but juice only until 10 am. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly, spacious, great location”
Reviews.Author: lizzyb23
Reviews.Content: A few days ago I took a quick last minute trip to the beach. I booked this hotel because of great reviews, oceanside location and price. It was much better than I had hoped. The staff were super friendly and went out of their way to help. The room was very spacious, clean and steps away from the sand. It was also one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed in - I didn't ever hear any noise from the hallway or our neighbors. My only complaint was that the breakfast buffet consisted of bagels and terrible pre-packaged pastries. Not even cereal. But that was minor compared to everything else. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Management/Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: alngeoffro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 5/29/08 - 6/1/08. We had booked a room in the building off the ocean. We didn't arrive until approx. 1:30 in the morning on our first night and upon getting to our room, we noticed a distint odor of amonia and/or cleaning solution. The carpet was damp too. We were too tired to deal with it at that time and we went to sleep. In the morning, my wife went to the front desk simply to ask them to have the maid try to do something about the smell and she was immediately told "Oh no, we won't have that. We have an empty oceanfront suite and we'll move you there." Totally unexpected, but very much appreciated!! Obviously very customer service oriented. The oceanfront room was beautiful. Very clean and spacious. Only negative comment would be that the wifi reception was spotty. Upon checkout, the front desk clerk was very friendly making sure my stay was OK and leaving me with a very pleasant "please come see us again." Sometimes it's just the little things and the staff of this hotel just did those little things right.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mleb88
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! My wife, child and I highly enjoyed our time in the Rodeway Inn Oceanfront and would definitely recommend it to others. It was clean, people were friendly, and exceeded our expectations, especially for the low price. Don't expect the Hilton, of course -- it's a basic motel, but definitely an excellent choice for the budget traveler. The indoor and outdoor pools, hallways, the room, bathroom, were all clean and pleasant. We had reserved a room on the parking-lot side, and asked when checking in if we could possibly be bumped up to the oceanfront side... and we were! No complaints... a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: natthecat
Reviews.Content: Spent Sept 10-15 at the Rodeway in the oceanfront building. It was a great place to stay. Room was spacious and clean with a nice balcony. The staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful and any requests were dealt with at once. Room was made up each day while we were at breakfast and the small continental breakfast was more than adequate if you are mostly a coffee and juice person. The location just two blocks north of the Boardwalk train is great and the beach is lovely in this area. This a good part of town to stay in as there are lots of things within walking distance. We were there during part of Bike week and did not find the bikers to be an annoyance at all. We will return to the Rodeway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer1968
Reviews.Content: The Rodeway Inn had a really great price and convenient location. We stayed in the building closest to the ocean on the 4th floor. It had great view of the outdoor pool and ocean. I found it to be clean and quiet. The cleaning staff vacumed the hallways constantly to keep up with the sand. And yes, they will change your sheets everyday, just ask. The staff asked us about changing the bed linens and we just said "yes" with 3 kids and the beach sand we needed it. The outdoor pool was fine and I watched them each morning vacuum it and wash down the deck. The indoor pool is kept very, very warm and kinda "grosses you out after a while." But the kids loved it. The ocean was wonderful. The water was warm and great waves to play in. I have a toddler and 2 school age children and the beach is not steep enough to be a problem. I looked at endless places to stay in Ocean City and there are some real dumps! But Rodeway for the money is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Motel --- Please read”
Reviews.Author: umberhulk
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a great deal on our hotel by simply contacting other hotels in the area. I scanned the Internet hotel sites and collected the addresses or Googled the hotels and told them what offers were on the sites and what other hotels were willing to take. Rodeway Inn gave me the best deal plus we used my girlfriends AAA discount card for additional savings. It was worth the extra two hours of mapping and calling. Every hotel I contacted was more than happy to undercut any competition. We stayed only two nights to top off our great vacation. I didn't book this hotel expecting a four star classy hotel. I wanted a clean room with one queen bed and a short walk to everywhere. Hotel Overview: Room: Yes, the motel on the street side is old and getting worn out, however, it was very clean. Our room greeted us with cold air, clean carpets, bright bathroom, fresh linens, microwave, and refrigerator. The walls were a bit thin, however we did not have any difficulty sleeping. The only negative about our room was the sliding glass door. We got locked out of the room. I asked a passer-by on the sidewalk to get somebody at the desk to get us back in our room. Although that was a negative, it was such a minor set back. The motel is old and the lock needed some WD-40. The janitor was up to our room in a jiffy and we were back inside. Staff: The staff is very friendly. We arrived early and had to wait about an hour for our room, but we were handed our key cards. We manged to plug up the toilet the first few minutes we were there (don't flush a lot of paper) and the janitor was at our door as soon as we called for a plunger. That is good service. The maids did a great job cleaning, the front desk staff provided us with courteous service. Location / Ammenities: We were a few blocks north of the boardwalk, but only a few steps from the trolley that only costs $2 to ride all day. The beach is only a few yards from the room. I didn't use the indoor pool because it was full of kids, but we used the outdoor pool. Nothing fancy, but it was clean. I was hoping for a hot tub, but there isn't one. The parking lot is large and easy to get around. I have a small car, but everybody else has an SUV and I didn't see any dents on them. Free Wi-Fi was in the lobby. I didn't bring my laptop - I was on vacation! The balconies in the building I stayed in were not very private, but nobody bugged us. There is an amusement park across the main drag. We played some Jungle Golf, but there was a lot more for kids and families. The motel offers a small breakfast buffet. Juices, tea, coffee, pre-packaged Sara Lee muffins, and pre-packaged danish. Actually it was very good. I like to get my OJ in the morning - and they had a huge supply of it. Final Thought: I'm not sure when we are going to OCMD again, but I would stay at this hotel again. I would prefer to stay at the ocean front building, but that is a lot more money for the pleasure of looking at the ocean. Thanks Rodeway Inn, we had a nice stay. Don't forget to go to English's breakfast and/or dinner buffet on 15th Street. Very, very good. Call and check prices before you and yours go out for dinner. We had a $65 mistake our first night there. Thanks for reading. I hope this helps your OCMD hotel quest.

Reviews.Title: “Good but very basic”
Reviews.Author: jelodi
Reviews.Content: As far as Ocean City hotels go, this one is decent and a good value for the money. No its not super fancy or swanky, but I go to the beach for the beach not the hotel. Check in was smooth with no problems and polite service. When we got to our room, the tv remote control was broken. I took it to the front desk not expecting that they would have an extra, and the man at the desk gave me the remote for the tv he was watching. (The remote had clearly been launched across the room at a wall by teenagers most likely.) The only problem we had was with late night noise coming through the somewhat thin walls on our third night. And I wouldn't get too excited about the "continental breakfast" as it consists of pre-wrapped muffins and danish, but the Fractured Prune donut shop is a quick walk from the hotel. Checkout was super quick with no wait or problems either. So its a very basic, but very decent and clean place to stay in O.C.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SusanDG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rodeway Oceanfront Inn during the weekend of Columbus Day 2006. It was not my first choice of hotels, however, the hotel that we always stayed at was booked. We stayed in the non-oceanfront rooms on the ground floor and were quite disappointed in the room and hotel facilities. Let's just say, we won't be staying at a Rodeway Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Pricing and Great View”
Reviews.Author: rescueboss
Reviews.Content: Well I stayed at this hotel after checking it online and I am a very big person about reading reviews of hotels. Here is what I found: I stayed in the ocean block building for the hotel which has 2 buildings. The room I had, faced the ocean and you could see part of the ocean from the hotel room and from the private belcony. The belcony has 2 chairs and small table and has a great view of the ocean front. The hotel room was clean and offered 2 double beds and has a small microwave and refrig. The hotel also had free high speed wireless internet which is another positive for the business traveler. The hotel also offers small morning start of the day in the lobby with coffee and danishs. As far as the location it is right on the beach which I loved and I am sharing pictures that I took from the hotels outdoor pools deck and happen to catch this picture. The boardwalk is a short walk up the beach and as far as other things nearby, there is plenty of food places and amusments depending on what your looking for. I will stay here again in the future and hope everyone agrees.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jkf18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the staff there is terrific. They were very accomodating in reserving our rooms close together and even upgraded us. All of the common areas are very clean and well maintained. Excellent value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Rodeway Inn on August of 2005, for a weekend getaway. It was very nice and clean, close the the boardwalk, and the most exited part was the ocean front, sitting on the balcony early in the morning to hear the nice relaxing waves of the ocean, we really enjoyed our stayed, the front desk staff was very friendly. Definetively I will come and stayed at the Rodeway Inn again, with one option it has to be an ocean front room.

Reviews.Title: “Pick the Oceanfront Rooms”
Reviews.Author: nanaof3
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in the motel part of this establishment. Our room was on the ground floor which was the only plus part of our stay. We have stayed in the oceanfront building on previous occassions and were delighted with our stays. The motel bulding definitely needs renovations or at least a good cleaning. The free breakfast leaves alot to be desired also. We might stay here again sometime but only in the oceanfront building!

Reviews.Title: “it was okay”
Reviews.Author: janna674
Reviews.Content: for the money I guess it was okay. the continental b'fast is a joke. The rooms were very small we had a queen and a balcony in the rodeside building...sitting on our balcony we could see the ocean. Two buildings over you can catch the boardwalk tram and 7/11 is across the street along with a liquor store and bar/restaurant that was great. The pools at the hotel were great and so was the beach. Everything was clean. A little sandy some places but it is to be expected. We will probably try a closer hotel to the boardwalk next time. The tram is expensive and slow. If you dont mind this hotel is perfect the tram is close.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great frontdesk staff”
Reviews.Author: mdgipsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the street front building which was actually quieter than I expected and had no problem with noise. The rooms were adequate, clean with a fridge and microwave. At $125 per night it was definitely the most economic in ocean city!! 2 blocks from the board walk. The front desk staff was VERY accomodating with a mistake on the final bill and took care of it no problem!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying at the Rodeway Inn Oceanfront”
Reviews.Author: Gd7Fowler
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just got back from the Rodeway Inn in MD. We stayed there from Aug. 6 to Aug 13th. We have 2 teens and a 21 yr old daughter. We arrived early at the Rodeway Inn and found the front desk to be very accomodating. We went out to eat and by the time we were done our room was ready about 2 hrs. early. The room was very comfortable for the 5 of us. We had comfortable beds and more than enough towels and anything else we asked for. The indoor pool was beautiful as was the outdoor pool.....some of the hotels in the area had very small pools and this hotel has large ones. We stayed on the second floor oceanfront. This room had a great view of the ocean. If you want to see the ocean make sure you stay on the second floor or above. The first floor has the dunes blocking the way. It took us only a couple minutes to get to the beach which we could see from the room. The location was perfect and we sat on the balcony every morning and had coffee watching the surfers in the ocean and also the dolphins playing in the waves. It was so relaxing.The room was non smoking and smelled very nice. We did have a small problem with the pull out sofa, my son slept on that and he sometimes had difficulty getting it open. But he always managed and never complained. At night the room was very quiet. The A/C helped with the noise level and kept the room very cool. The only drawback was the continental breakfast...it consisted of mini muffins, mini bagals, small danishes and coffee and juice. Not bad just limited in protein choices. Yes we will go back to this hotel when we come back to Ocean City. It was an easy walk to the boardwalk and far enough away to avoid the crouds. We ate at the Angler and enjoyed the free cruise after dinner...very nice. We ate at Coins for lunch one day and had a great meal. It was nice to have a microwave and fridge in the room as my teens loved to eat lunch after being on the beach or at the pool. All in all a great family stay. Would do it again and will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating, friendly front desk”
Reviews.Author: reinekim1
Reviews.Content: We just got back into town today after a 3 day vacation at the Rodeway Inn, Ocean City, Md. The front desk attendants couldn't possibly have been more helpful and accommodating. When we got there, we were assigned to room 119, bottom floor facing the main street. I asked the front desk lady whether it was possible to be moved to the second floor, since we liked the look of having a balcony. She searched the computer, and found that a room on the second floor was coming available the next morning, and we could have that. Room 119 had plenty of space for us (there were 3 of us, my husband, myself, and 11 year old son). The only complaint I had with the room was that we could hear the road noise at night. And it could get loud. Next day they transferred us to room 215. The room was hot when we opened the door, so we cranked up the A/C and went to the beach for a couple hours. There was no improvement when we got back to our room. My husband took the little A/C unit apart and cleaned it in the tub. It was so filthy and clogged. We figured it would work now. No. I called the front desk and told them what was happening with our A/C. He called me back in about 5 minutes and said that they would move us to the front building, overlooking the ocean, to room 404. That was the last thing we expected! We spent about $170 a night for our room in the one building, knowing we didn't have the extra money for the oceanview. That room was magnificent! Oh my God. We were in heaven. So, I guess as far as I'm concerned, the front desk went above and beyond making our stay right for us. Now, as far as the restaurants go....against my better judgement we went to Paul Revere smorgasbord for dinner one night. It was awful. Really. The food looked like it had been sitting in the pans for a good while. There were things on that buffet that I didn't recognize! The turkey and roast beef were chewy. We spit it out into our napkins...it was that bad. Next day we still had heartburn. Yick. We went to Jonah the Whale for seafood buffet one night. That was ok. It was like $27 for the buffet. Good tasting. We went to Hall's on 60th street for their breakfast buffet. Well worth the drive! It was the best buffet we'd seen. I would love to go back to Ocean City again, but I think we'll stay somewhere in the "teen" streets. It was a very long walk to the boardwalk shops from 29th street. All in all, we had a wonderful time.
